answers.answer: Wow. Really?  No one has experienced this? This is really getting annoying already every question or simple advice I ask no one has an answer too it!  But wait let me post about baby daddy drama and everyone and their mothers will answer!  Smfh

That wasn't really a question. Plus it's the middle of the night.  If you meant to ask if it's normal, then yes it is. Drink more water and try to stay off your feet. If they stay swollen though, your doctor may have to check you for preeclampsia.

Calm down!  Only reason I saw this is because I'm on graveyard shift. Yes, you're swelling,  but shouldn't you know that it's normal? Google it, go on babycenter, WebMD, something.  It's a normal thing that everybody faces.
First of all i dnt alway's post at night I have posted about the middle of the day and it's pretty much the same thing!

So your swollen. If your worried ask your doctor about it. I know what your saying tho a lot of people on here only comment on things that have to deal with drama or active labor. But then again this is an app full of pregnant women so what do you expect we need to rant and rave about something to women who are also feeling thr same way. But just remember this is a forum non of us (unless we are a licensed medical professionals) really have the correct information or advice to give you. Your better off researching it online from a site or calling your dr/midwife for advice. We can only give you info from what we've experienced or have read about ourselves.

question: And already my feet get swollen and so do my hands
title: 28 weeks and two days
